name: acerbity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being spoken or written in a way that is direct, clever, and cruel: She was known for her acerbity. "Do be quiet, Paul," Monica said, with unaccustomed acerbity. See
acerbic
More examplesFewer examples"You speak as though you control the weather," Jill said with acerbity. In spite of his occasional acerbity, he is a very warm person. She notes, with some acerbity, that she has to invent more macho excuses for time off than her male colleagues.
